This property verifies that when the load signal is asserted high, the counter signal must equal the previous value of the count signal on the next clock cycle.

The trigger condition occurs on every positive edge of the clk when the load signal is 1. If this happens, the property expects that one clock cycle later, the counter signal will match the value that the count signal had at the time the load signal was asserted.

The property is disabled when the reset signal is active high, meaning the verification does not apply during reset conditions.

The $past function is used to reference the historical value of the count signal from the previous clock cycle.
